required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT Imaging in Patients With Suspected Recurrence of Prostate Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Multi-Center, Open-Label Study to Assess the Diagnostic Performance and Clinical Impact of 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT Imaging Results in Men With Suspected Recurrence of Prostate Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the diagnostic performance and safety of 18F-DCFPyL (PyL) PET/CT imaging in patients with suspected recurrence of prostate cancer who have negative or equivocal findings on conventional imaging.

primary_outcome.description: The Correct Localization Rate (CLR) will be defined as percentage of participants with a one-to-one correspondence between localization of at least one lesion identified on 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT imaging and the composite truth standard. Within 60 days following PyL PET/CT imaging, either biopsy/surgery, conventional imaging, or locoregional radiation therapy of the PyL-suspected lesion(s) will be performed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Change in Intended Prostate Cancer Treatment Plans Due to 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT Imaging Results.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT imaging and within 60 days following 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT imaging.
secondary_outcome.description: The change in the intended prostate cancer treatment plan will be based on Medical Management Questionnaires completed prior to and after 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT imaging.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Change From Pre- to Post- 18F-DCFPyl Dosing in Blood Pressure (Safety Outcome Measure)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at 2 intervals on the day of dosing; the first interval prior to receiving the 18F-DCFPyL dose and the second interval within 60 to 120 minutes after dosing.
secondary_outcome.description: The recorded values and their respective changes from the pre-dose values will be summarized using descriptive statistics.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Change From Pre- to Post- 18F-DCFPyL Dosing in Heart Rate (Safety Outcome Measure)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at 2 intervals on the day of dosing; the first interval prior to receiving the 18F-DCFPyL dose and the second interval within 60 to 120 minutes after dosing.
secondary_outcome.description: The recorded values and their respective changes from the pre-dose values will be summarized using descriptive statistics.

secondary_outcome.measure: Collection of Concomitant Medications (Safety Outcome Measure)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of 18F-DCFPyL dosing to completion of the follow-up visit at 7 (±3) days after 18F-DCFPyL dosing.
secondary_outcome.description: Medications will be coded using the WHO drug dictionary. The medications are summarized by ATC level 4 category and presented as number and percentage of participants. Results are presented where the percentage of participants within an ATC level 4 category is >5.0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Collection of Medical Procedures (Safety Outcome Measure)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of 18F-DCFPyL dosing to completion of the follow-up visit at 7 (±3) days after 18F-DCFPyL dosing.
secondary_outcome.description: Procedures will be coded using the same version of MedDRA as for medical history. Medical procedures will be displayed as a listing by participant.

intervention.description: A single dose of 9 mCi (333 MBq) IV injection of 18F-DCFPyL
PET/CT imaging will be acquired 1-2 hours post-PyL injection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male >/= 18 years of age
- Histopathologically confirmed prostate adenocarcinoma per original diagnosis, with subsequent definitive therapy
- Suspected recurrence of prostate cancer based on rising PSA after definitive therapy on the basis of:
1. Post-radical prostatectomy: Detectable or rising PSA that is ≥ 0.2 ng/mL with a confirmatory PSA ≥ 0.2 ng/mL (American Urological Association [AUA]); or
2. Post-radiation therapy, cryotherapy, or brachytherapy: Increase in PSA level that is elevated by ≥ 2 ng/mL above the nadir (American Society for Therapeutic Radiology and Oncology [ASTRO]-Phoenix)
- Negative or equivocal findings for prostate cancer on conventional imaging performed as part of standard of care workup within 60 days prior to Day 1
- Life expectancy ≥6 months as determined by the investigator
- Able and willing to provide informed consent and comply with protocol requirements
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects administered any high energy (>300 KeV) gamma-emitting radioisotope within five (5) physical half-lives prior to Day 1
- Ongoing treatment with any systemic therapy (e.g. ADT, antiandrogen, GnRH, LHRH agonist or antagonist) for prostate cancer
- Treatment with ADT in the past 3 months of Day 1
- Receipt of investigational therapy for prostate cancer within 60 days of Day 1
- Subjects with any medical condition or other circumstances that, in the opinion of the investigator, compromise the safety or compliance of the subject to produce reliable data or completing the study

eligibility.gender_description: Only males subjects will be enrolled in this study.

facility.name: City of Hope National Medical Center
University of California San Francisco - Helen Diller Cancer Center
Washington University - Mallinckrodt Institute of Radiology

group.title: 18F-DCFPyL Injection
group.description: Participants with suspected recurrence of prostate cancer and negative or equivocal findings per institutional standard of care conventional imaging were enrolled to receive a single dose of 9 mCi (333 MBq) 18F-DCFPyL injection followed by a single PET/CT scan acquired 1 to 2 hours post-dosing.

baseline.population: Safety population; all participants who received any amount of 18F-DCFPyL

group.title: 18F-DCFPyL Injection
group.description: Participants with suspected recurrence of prostate cancer and negative or equivocal findings per institutional standard of care conventional imaging were enrolled to receive a single dose of 9 mCi (333 MBq) 18F-DCFPyL injection followed by a single PET/CT scan acquired 1 to 2 hours post-dosing.

outcome.title: Correct Localization Rate (CLR)
outcome.description: The Correct Localization Rate (CLR) will be defined as percentage of participants with a one-to-one correspondence between localization of at least one lesion identified on 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT imaging and the composite truth standard. Within 60 days following PyL PET/CT imaging, either biopsy/surgery, conventional imaging, or locoregional radiation therapy of the PyL-suspected lesion(s) will be performed.
outcome.population: Participants who received any amount of 18F-DCFPyL and had a 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT central imaging reader result.

group.title: 18F-DCFPyL Injection
group.description: Participants with suspected recurrence of prostate cancer and negative or equivocal findings per institutional standard of care conventional imaging were enrolled to receive a single dose of 9 mCi (333 MBq) 18F-DCFPyL injection followed by a single PET/CT scan acquired 1 to 2 hours post-dosing.

measure.title: Correct Localization Rate (CLR)
measure.description: The Correct Localization Rate (CLR) will be defined as percentage of participants with a one-to-one correspondence between localization of at least one lesion identified on 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT imaging and the composite truth standard. Within 60 days following PyL PET/CT imaging, either biopsy/surgery, conventional imaging, or locoregional radiation therapy of the PyL-suspected lesion(s) will be performed.
measure.population: Participants who received any amount of 18F-DCFPyL and had a 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT central imaging reader result.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a Change in Intended Prostate Cancer Treatment Plans Due to 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT Imaging Results.
outcome.description: The change in the intended prostate cancer treatment plan will be based on Medical Management Questionnaires completed prior to and after 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT imaging.

outcome.population: Participants with a Medical Management Questionnaire (MMQ) completed at pre- and post- 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT imaging.

group.description: Participants with suspected recurrence of prostate cancer and negative or equivocal findings per institutional standard of care conventional imaging were enrolled to receive a single dose of 9 mCi (333 MBq) 18F-DCFPyL injection followed by a single PET/CT scan acquired 1 to 2 hours post-dosing.

outcome.description: The recorded values and their respective changes from the pre-dose values will be summarized using descriptive statistics.

outcome.population: The Safety Set includes all participants who received any amount of 18F-DECPyL.

outcome.title: Collection of Concomitant Medications (Safety Outcome Measure)
outcome.description: Medications will be coded using the WHO drug dictionary. The medications are summarized by ATC level 4 category and presented as number and percentage of participants. Results are presented where the percentage of participants within an ATC level 4 category is >5.0.
outcome.time_frame: From the time of 18F-DCFPyL dosing to completion of the follow-up visit at 7 (±3) days after 18F-DCFPyL dosing.
outcome.population: The Safety Set includes all participants who received any amount of 18F-DCFPyL.

measure.population: The Safety Set includes all participants who received any amount of 18F-DCFPyL.

reported_events.time_frame: Treatment-emergent adverse events were collected after 18F-DCFPyL administration on Day 1 post-dose through the safety visit 7 (±3) days post-dosing.

group.title: 18F-DCFPyL Injection
group.description: Participants with suspected recurrence of prostate cancer and negative or equivocal findings per institutional standard of care conventional imaging were enrolled to receive a single dose of 9 mCi (333 MBq) 18F-DCFPyL injection followed by a single PET/CT scan acquired 1 to 2 hours post-dosing.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Study results cannot be published before the earlier of a multi-site publication; or 18 months after the end of the Study at all sites; or confirmation by Sponsor that there will be no multi-site publication. The proposed publication must be submitted to Sponsor at least 60 days prior to publication so that Sponsor can delete Sponsor Confidential Information (other than Study results) and obtain a further 60 days to file on any invention disclosed in the proposed publication.
